reviews.review_msg: I'm not sure why Mike gets all this hate, I honestly loved him as a professor! While his lectures are extremely knowledge dense, he is super kind and caring and is happy to explain concepts you don't understand again. The quizzes are difficult, but nothing felt out of the realm of an upper BISC course and he drops your lowest score!

Mike is a sweetheart but the content is crazy. So much to memorize, quizzes ask the most niche questions so you have to study all the material. TA was a blessing and the field trip was a highlight for sure. Just be prepared to study a lot, and write LOTS of notes in class as theres nothing on his slides Sucked that lab was so ahead of the lecture

Amazing prof!  His course material is very dense but he shows genuine interest in the material and cares for students.  Lots of material to cover which is a fault of the course and not him, he does a great job of making it interesting and digestible.
Lectures are insanely uninformative as you are required to pay attention to every single detail he mentions and the slides he provides are basically useless (better off with the textbook).

I started the course with a positive-neutral mindset, and ended up hating the lec portion because of how hard to follow his lectures are. Lecture slides are just a bunch of diagrams, his material can be phylogeny-heavy, and there's so much material examinable for one quiz (total of 4). My experience in short: crammed my brain with difficult names.

His textbook is an encyclopedia. Do NOT bother reading it. It will take you years upon years upon years. Therefore LECTURE MATERIAL, LECTURE MATERIAL, LECTURE MATERIAL. Some chapters are 100 pages. And each chapter corresponds to a single lecture.
15 chapters on the midterm!!!!!! not so much hard just way too much info at once
